instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Kernel Panics
threads.message:
This 2012 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook air has kernel panics from time to time (approximately 1 reboot on 10).
No water damage, never been opened, according to the mint condition casing I don't suspect a drop.
Kernel panics occurs during the boot, it hangs approximately in the middle of the apple progress bar. It happens approximately once upon 10 reboots.
When it hangs I can see the mouse and caps lock is working. When OS boots ok I see the kernel panics report.

I tried to boot it with external USB HDD and there is no error.
It passes both OS and EFI ASD.
I suspected bad SSD, but this one is fully working in a 2012 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, and I have same issue with other SSD...

I attached 2 kernel panics crashes.

If needed I will try to include a verbose mode list but the crash doesn't happen when I want to catch it :)
Any hints where to start? I am thinking about the sata redriver circuit, but I really have no clue especially when no damage is apparent.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Kernel Panics
threads.message: Both kernel panics are different. I have no idea what this could be, too many possibilities. Maybe replace <CHIP>U4510</CHIP>, but that is where this one ends.
